meanings.definition: To remove the beak of (a bird)
meanings.sent1: The vet debeaks the parrot to prevent it from biting.
meanings.sent2: The farmer debeaks the chickens for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The magician debeaks the dove, turning it into a beakless wonder!
meanings.sent4: She debeaks her problems, cutting them off before they can peck at her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The chef debeaks the duck with precision, preparing it for a delicious meal.

meanings.definition: The act of removing the beak of a bird
meanings.sent1: After the debeaks, the bird struggled to eat properly.
meanings.sent2: The debeaks of the parrots were done to protect the handlers.
meanings.sent3: The debeaks of the geese made them look like little honking aliens.
meanings.sent4: The debeaks of the swans symbolized a loss of grace and beauty.
meanings.sent5: The debeaks of the pigeons left them silent and defenseless.
